doc.after: Lactuca sativa is a member of the Lactuca (lettuce) genus and the Asteraceae (sunflower or aster) family.[4] The species was first described in 1753 by Carl Linnaeus in the second volume of his Species Plantarum.[5] Synonyms for L.Â sativa include Lactuca scariola var. sativa,[1] L.Â scariola var. integrata and L.Â scariola var. integrifolia.[6] L.Â scariola is itself a synonym for L.Â serriola, the common wild or prickly lettuce.[2] L.Â sativa also has many identified taxonomic groups, subspecies and varieties, which delineate the various cultivar groups of domesticated lettuce.[7] Lettuce is closely related to several Lactuca species from southwest Asia; the closest relationship is to L.Â serriola, an aggressive weed common in temperate and subtropical zones in much of the world.[8]
